intro: Macrolearia colensoi, commonly known as the Colenso's macrolearia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley. The plant is characterized by its distinctive umbellate inflorescence and finely divided, feathery leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
